summary: This document discusses the New York Attorney General's inquiry into Jeffrey Epstein's charitable foundation, seeking compliance with state registration requirements. It highlights the relationship between Epstein and his attorney Darren Indyke, who responds to the inquiry regarding the foundation's activities and registration status in New York.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is identified as Epstein's in-house lawyer and is involved in responding to the New York Attorney General's inquiries regarding Epstein's charitable foundation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in the document, whose philanthropic activities are under scrutiny by the New York Attorney General.

persons.name: Eric Schneiderman
persons.context: Eric Schneiderman is mentioned as the Attorney General seeking information about Epstein's foundation's compliance with New York law.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew is referenced in relation to allegations involving Epstein, which have contributed to Epstein's notoriety.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Alan Dershowitz is mentioned as a prominent lawyer who has denied allegations related to Epstein.

connections.description: Darren Indyke serves as Epstein's attorney, handling legal matters related to Epstein's foundation.
Indyke is in communication with Attorney General Schneiderman regarding the legal status of Epstein's foundation.
Epstein is linked to Prince Andrew through allegations of misconduct involving underage girls.
Dershowitz is mentioned in the context of defending against allegations related to Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein pleads guilty to procuring an underage girl for prostitution, serving 13 months in jail.

events.title: AG Inquiry Letter
events.description: The New York Attorney General's Office sends a letter to Epstein's foundation regarding compliance with state law.

events.title: Indyke's Response
events.description: Darren Indyke responds to the Attorney General's inquiry, asserting that the foundation does not engage in charitable activities in New York.

keyFacts: Darren Indyke has been an in-house lawyer for Jeffrey Epstein for over 15 years.
The New York Attorney General is investigating Epstein's charitable foundation for compliance with state laws.
Epstein's foundation is incorporated in the U.S. Virgin Islands and is required to register in New York if it conducts activities there.
Epstein has a history of philanthropy, particularly towards Harvard University, but the extent of his donations is unclear due to lack of transparency.
Three past grant recipients have declined future gifts from Epstein amid allegations against him.
